quote: We cannot control the evil tongues of others; but a good life enables us to disregard them.
All that is necessary for the triumph of evil is that good men do nothing.
There are thousands hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root.
A misery is not to be measure from the nature of the evil, but from the temper of the sufferer.
A resolution to avoid an evil is seldom framed till the evil is so far advanced as to make avoidance impossible.
A Sunday school is a prison in which children do penance for the evil conscience of their parents.
A vigorous temper is not altogether an evil. Men who are easy as an old shoe are generally of little worth.
All evil is like a nightmare; the instant you stir under it, the evil is gone.
All good is hard. All evil is easy. Dying, losing, cheating, and mediocrity is easy. Stay away from easy.
Although modesty is natural to man, it is not natural to children. Modesty only begins with the knowledge of evil.
An evil life is a kind of death.
We cannot control the evil tongues of others; but a good life enables us to disregard them.
All that is necessary for the triumph of evil is that good men do nothing.
There are thousands hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root.
A misery is not to be measure from the nature of the evil, but from the temper of the sufferer.
A resolution to avoid an evil is seldom framed till the evil is so far advanced as to make avoidance impossible.
A Sunday school is a prison in which children do penance for the evil conscience of their parents.
A vigorous temper is not altogether an evil. Men who are easy as an old shoe are generally of little worth.
All evil is like a nightmare; the instant you stir under it, the evil is gone.
All good is hard. All evil is easy. Dying, losing, cheating, and mediocrity is easy. Stay away from easy.
Although modesty is natural to man, it is not natural to children. Modesty only begins with the knowledge of evil.
An evil life is a kind of death.
Be good to others, that will protect you against evil.
Boredom is the root of all evil - the despairing refusal to be oneself.
Both mind and heart when given up to reveries and dreaminess, have a thousand avenues open for the entrance of evil.
But evil is wrought by want of thought as well as want of heart!
But, soon or late, it is ideas, not vested interests, which are dangerous for good or evil.
Capital as such is not evil; it is its wrong use that is evil. Capital in some form or other will always be needed.
Conscience is the window of our spirit, evil is the curtain.
Constantly choosing the lesser of two evils is still choosing evil.
Cursed is the man who dies, but the evil done by him survives.
Destroy the seed of evil, or it will grow up to your ruin.
Don't speak evil of someone if you don't know for certain, and if you do know ask yourself, why am I telling it?
Enjoy things which are pleasant; that is not the evil: it is the reducing of our moral self to slavery by them that is.
Every journalist owes tribute to the evil one.
Every sweet has its sour; every evil its good.
Evil and ugliness are the same thing, and dullness is the mother of both.
Evil being the root of mystery, pain is the root of knowledge.
Evil comes at leisure like the disease. Good comes in a hurry like the doctor.
Evil exists in the world not to create despair but activity.
Evil is always possible. Goodness is a difficulty.
Evil is done without effort, naturally, it is the working of fate; good is always the product of an art.
Evil is easy, and has infinite forms.
Evil is like water, it abounds, is cheap, soon fouls, but runs itself clear of taint.
Evil is not something superhuman, it's something less than human.
Evil is nourished and grows by concealment.
Evil is the interruption of a truth by the pressure of particular or individual interests.
Evil is the moment when I lack the strength to be true to the Good that compels me.
Evil is unspectacular and always human, and shares our bed and eats at our own table.
Evil is whatever distracts.
False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
Far from idleness being the root of all evil, it is rather the only true good.
For neither man nor angel can discern hypocrisy, the only evil that walks invisible, except to God alone.
Forcible ways make not an end of evil, but leave hatred and malice behind them.
Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
Good courage in a bad affair is half of the evil overcome.
Good is that which makes for unity. Evil is that which makes for separateness.
Government, even in its best state, is but a necessary evil; in its worst state, an intolerable one.
Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.
He that is kind is free, though he is a slave; he that is evil is a slave, though he be a king.
He who does evil that good may come, pays a toll to the devil to let him into heaven.
He who passively accepts evil is as much involved in it as he who helps to perpetrate it.
How easy it is to judge rightly after one sees what evil comes from judging wrongly!
However things may seem, no evil thing is success and no good thing is failure.
I am in politics because of the conflict between good and evil, and I believe that in the end good will triumph.
I am one of those who think like Nobel, than humanity will draw more good than evil from new discoveries.
I am so changeable, being every thing by turns and nothing long,— I am such a strange mélange of good and evil.
I believe that, as long as there is plenty, poverty is evil.
I consider promiscuity immoral. Not because sex is evil, but because sex is too good and too important.
I do not believe in the God of theology who rewards good and punishes evil.
I have discovered that all human evil comes from this, man's being unable to sit still and quiet in a room alone.
I hope that real love and truth are stronger in the end than any evil or misfortune in the world.
I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent.
I wouldn't say Jamie is an evil genius. I'm not sure he's evil and I'm not sure he's a genius.
If a man devotes himself to art, much evil is avoided that happens otherwise if one is idle.
If evil be spoken of you and it be true, correct yourself, if it be a lie, laugh at it.
If there was no moral evil upon earth, there would be no physical evil.
Ignorance... is a painless evil; so, I should think, is dirt, considering the merry faces that go along with it.
In real life, the hardest aspect of the battle between good and evil is determining which is which.
Indifference, to me, is the epitome of evil.
It has been said that the love of money is the root of all evil. The want of money is so quite as truly.
It is a beautiful trait in the lovers character, that they think no evil of the object loved.
It is a cursed evil to any man to become as absorbed in any subject as I am in mine.
It is a sin to believe evil of others, but it is rarely a mistake.
It is a sin to believe evil of others, but it is seldom a mistake.
It is by its promise of a sense of power that evil often attracts the weak.
It is ideas, not vested interests, which are dangerous for good or evil.
It is the constant fault and inseparable evil quality of ambition, that it never looks behind it.
It is very necessary to have markers of beauty left in a world seemingly bent on making the most evil ugliness.
It must be that evil communications corrupt good dispositions.
January, month of empty pockets! Let us endure this evil month, anxious as a theatrical producer's forehead.
Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.
Knowledge becomes evil if the aim be not virtuous.
Lack of money is the root of all evil.
Let us believe neither half of the good people tell us of ourselves, nor half the evil they say of others.
Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.
Man must vanquish himself, must do himself violence, in order to perform the slightest action untainted by evil.
May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.-
Men never do evil so fully and cheerfully as when we do it out of conscience.
Men's evil manners live in brass, their virtues we write in water.
Men's hearts ought not to be set against one another, but set with one another, and all against evil only.
Mischief and malice grow on the same branch of the tree of evil.
Money is the fruit of evil, as often as the root of it.
Most modern reproducers of life, even including the camera, really repudiate it. We gulp down evil, choke at good.
Nature has no principles. She makes no distinction between good and evil.
Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other ones invariably slink in after it.
No evil dooms us hopelessly except the evil we love, and desire to continue in, and make no effort to escape from.
No evil is honorable: but death is honorable; therefore death is not evil.
No evil propensity of the human heart is so powerful that it may mot be subdued by discipline.
No man chooses evil because it is evil; he only mistakes it for happiness.
No man is justified in doing evil on the ground of expediency.
No notice is taken of a little evil, but when it increases it strikes the eye.
Non-cooperation with evil is as much a duty as is cooperation with good.
None are all evil,
Nothing baffles the schemes of evil people so much as the calm composure of great souls.
auther: Honoré Gabriel Riqueti Count of Mirabeau

quote: Of what use is the memory of facts, if not to serve as an example of good or of evil?
One soweth and another reapeth is a verity that applies to evil as well as good.
One that confounds good and evil is an enemy to good.
Only among people who think no evil can Evil monstrously flourish.
Our minds should not be empty because if they are not preoccupied by good, evil will break in upon them.
Piety is the most solid goodness, and the vilest of what is evil is vice.
Pleasure is the greatest incentive to evil.
Point me out the happy man and I will point you out either egotism, selfishness, evil - or else an absolute ignorance.
Religion and education are no match for evil without the grace of God.
So you think that money is the root of all evil? [...] Have you ever asked what is the root of money?
Some people show evil as a great racehorse shows breeding. They have the dignity of a hard chancre.
Speak no evil of the dead.
Submit to the present evil, lest a greater one befall you.
The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.
The confession of evil works is the first beginning of good works.
The difference being that in films, unlike in life, good does always win over evil in the end.
The evil that men do lives after them; the good is oft interred with their bones.
The face of evil is always the face of total need.
The first evil those who are prone to talk suffer, is that they hear nothing.
The greatest evil is physical pain.
The humblest individual exerts some influence, either for good or evil, upon others.
The mere apprehension of a coming evil has put many into a situation of the utmost danger.
The multitude of books is a great evil. There is no limit to this fever for writing.
The only good is knowledge and the only evil is ignorance.
The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
The person who said money is the root of all evil just flat out didn't have any.
The pious pretence that evil does not exist only makes it vague, enormous and menacing.
The purpose of life is not to fight against evil and misfortune; it is to unveil magnificence.
The sum of evil, Pascal remarked, would be much diminished if men could only learn to sit quietly in their rooms.
The urge to gamble is so universal and its practice so pleasurable that I assume it must be evil.
The want of money is the root of all evil.
The wise man avoids evil by anticipating it.
The world is the best of all possible worlds, and everything in it is a necessary evil.
There are heroes in evil as well as in good.
There can be no existence of evil as a force to the healthy-minded individual.
There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.
There is hardly a man clever enough to recognize the full extent of the evil he does.
There is no evil in the atom; only in men's souls.
There is only one good - knowledge; and only one evil - ignorance.
There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.
They that know no evil will suspect none.
This is the curse of an evil deed, that it incites and must bring forth more evil.
This is the way of peace: Overcome evil with good, falsehood with truth, and hatred with love.
Those who corrupt the public mind are just as evil as those who steal from the public purse.
To be free from evil thoughts is God's best gift.
To be innocent is to be not guilty; but to be virtuous is to overcome our evil inclinations.
To do no evil is good, to intend none better.
To do nothing evil is good; to wish nothing evil is better.
To fight against the infidels is Jihad; but to fight against your evil self is greater Jihad.
Virtue cannot separate itself from reality without becoming a principle of evil.
We believe at once in evil, we only believe in good upon reflection. Is this not sad?
We may draw good out of evil; we must not do evil, that good may come.
We often do good in order that we may do evil with impunity.
What makes people happy is activity; changing evil itself into good by power, working in a God like manner.
Whatever evil a man may think of women, there is no woman but thinks more.
Whatever is done for love always occurs beyond good and evil.
When you choose the lesser of two evils, always remember that it is still an evil.
Whenever you are angry, be assured that it is not only a present evil, but that you have increased a habit.
Where there is mystery, it is generally suspected there must also be evil.
Where there is mystery, it is generally suspected there must also be evil.
Wisdom we know is the knowledge of good and evil - not the strength to choose between the two.
Work and struggle and never accept an evil that you can change.
Work is a necessary evil to be avoided.
Yea, though I walk through the valley of death I will fear no evil, for I am the meanest son of a bitch in the valley.
You may either win your peace or buy it: win it, by resistance to evil; buy it, by compromise with evil.
